alert.note: Alert for Isle of Wight (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:42PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Isle of Wight County through 715 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rescue to near Smithfield to near Isle Of Wight. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Smithfield, Isle Of Wight, Rescue, Carrollton, Benns Church, Bethel Church, Mogarts Beach, Lawson, Central Hill, Longview and Rushmere. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in Ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
